label: I. Accelerated smallholder transformation process in the targeted districts from continous commitment of local goverment and stakeholders

children.label: Achieved effective sustainable smallholder program governance through commitment and support from the local government, private sector (supply chain actors), stakeholders, and the utilization of MIS
# of support (in the form of legal documents) provided by the stakeholders (government, UL Suppliers, companies, NGOs) as a result of better data governance
# of smallholders receiving support from stakeholders (disaggregated based on type: loans, grants, etc)

label: II. Improved smallholder oil palm businesses

children.label: Improved organizational management of the smallholder group toward professional and productive organizations
[ # , % ] of smallholder groups that have access to financing (e.g. Loans, Grant)
[ # , % ] of farmer groups have their own productive business units that support palm oil productivity
% of Smallholders who received support that are satisfied with support relevance and effectiveness
% farmer groups that increased level of maturity (refer to assessment dari busdev specialist)

label: III. Improved sustainable and traceable palm oil supply chain at district level

children.label: [ 1 ] Improved palm oil yield and quality through the consistent implementation of the Regenerative Agriculture Practices
% of farmer groups increased scores in knowledge assessment in trainings for sustainable agricultural practices and regenerative agriculture
% farmer groups who implemented BMP, RA and SAP
% of farmer groups that are SAP Assured
% increase in smallholder palm oil productivity (annual basis) (target: 5-20% from its level in 2025)
% increase in Income generated from credits on an annual basis
